episode_summary: This episode covers a range of topics including the impact of non-verbal cues in presidential debates, the discovery of new species through unconventional methods, a historical reenactment of the march to the Battle of Hastings, and a humorous scientific finding about perception when viewing objects from between the legs.

facts.fact: This week's presidential debate was best watched with the sound turned off.
A frog just vomited up a new species of ant.
A group of Saxon soldiers is marching 300 miles towards Hastings.
Scientists have concluded that objects look smaller when viewed from between the legs.
